src_text: Meketeko ya matswalo a Fort Hare yeo e dirilwego semmu o ke Mopresidente Jacob Zuma e bile ya katleg Baeng ba makgolokgolo, go akaret wa baithuti ba maloba le Mopresidente wa Zimbabwean Robert Mugabe gammogo le batseta ba tsenet e se upo se se bohlokwa mo historing ya Afrika BorwSe se sepelelana le Kgwedi ya Afrika, yeo e ketekago go hlongwa ga Mokgatlo wa Kgwerano ya Afrika (OAU) ya pele, yeo gonabjale e bit wago Kopano ya Afrika (AU).Kabinete e amogela t welopele yeo e dirilwego ka go rarolla mathata a baithuti, ao a bego a sa swanela go ba a hlot e go senywa ga thot Mo ketelong ya mo omo ya Mopresidente Jacob Zuma mo Repabliking ya Uganda, Dihlogo t a Dinaga ka moka di dumelelane go matlafat a dikamano t a mohlakanelwa, gomme ba boledi ana ka maemo a dipolotiki le t hirelet o ka Repabliking ya Burundi le bohlabela bja Repabliki ya Temokrasi ya CongMopresidente Jacob Zuma o tsenet e gape moletlo wa tlhomami o wa Mopresidente Yoweri Museven Go fihla nakong ye Afrika Borwa le Uganda di saenne ditumelelano t a mohlakanelwa t e 20, ka tekanyet o ya dikhamphani t a Afrika Borwa t e 70 t eo gonabjale di
trg_text: Implementation of Key Government Programmes The Fort Hare centenary celebrations which were officiated by President Jacob Zuma were a succes Hundreds of guests, including Alumni and Zimbabwean President Robert Mugabe as well as diplomats attended this prestigious milestone in South Africa s historThis coincided with Africa Month, which commemorates the founding of the then Organisation of African Unity, now called the African Union (AU).

src_text: omago ka Ugand Ka 2015, diyantle t a Afrika Borwa ka Uganda ke t a kgoboko ya Rbilione mola dit wantle t a Afrika Borwa e le palomoka ya R98 milionKabinete e amogela phethagat o ya katlego ya Ketelo ya Mmu o mo Mmu ong wa Qatar ya Mopresidente Jacob Zuma le go saena ditumelelano t e mmalwa le ditlamego, t a go swana le Tumelelano go Tiri ano ya T hirelet o, Tiri ano ya Maphodisa, le Tiri ano ya Bokgabo, Set o le Bohw Go thongwa ga Komiti ya Peelet o ya Mohlakanelwa go hlokomela phethagat o ya ditumelelano go tlalelet a Ditheri ano t a Mohlakanelwa t e di beakant wego di kaonafat a le go godi a dikamano t a mohlakanelwa go ya legatong leo le beakant wegTsenelelano ya Mopresidente le Foramo ya Kgwebo ya Qatari le Afrika Borwa e godi it e tiri ano ya Kgwebo go ya go Kgwebo yeo maekemi et o a yona e lego go oket a diekonomi ka mok Ge dinaga ka moka di na le maswanedi a go ba dinaga t a lewatle kgonagalo ya tiri ano mo Ekonoming ya Mawatle le yona go boledi anwe ka yon Dikhamphani t e mmalwa t a Afrika Borwa, kudu ka lekaleng le le amanago le Petrokhemikhale ye e
trg_text: issues, which should not have caused the destruction to propert On a working visit by President Jacob Zuma to the Republic of Uganda, both Heads of State agreed to strengthen bilateral relations, and discussed the political and security situation in the Republic of Burundi and eastern Democratic Republic of CongPresident Jacob Zuma also attended the inauguration ceremony of President Yoweri Museven South Africa and Uganda have so far 20 signed bilateral agreements, with approximately 70 South African companies currently operating in Ugand In 2015, South African exports to Uganda amounted to Rbillion while South African imports totaled R98 millio Cabinet welcomes the successful conclusion of President Jacob Zuma s State Visit to the State of Qatar with the signing of several agreements and commitments, such as the Agreements on Defence Cooperation, Police Cooperation, and Cooperation in Arts, Culture and Heritag The establishment of a Joint Investment Committee to oversee the implementation of agreements in addition to the structured Bilateral Consultations enhances and elevates bilateral relations to a strategic leveThe President's interaction with the South Africa-Qatari Business Forum promoted Business-to-Business cooperation aimed at diversifying both economie With both countries qualifying as maritime countries the potential for cooperation in the Oceans Economy was also discusse A number of South African companies, mainly in the Petrochemical-related sector operate in Qata One of South Africa's largest investments in the Middle East is Sasol, which plays an important role in the development of Qatar s gas reserveOther issues discussed include trade and economic relations as well as global and regional peace and security matter President Jacob Zuma handed over compensation for land as part of Phase 1 of the settlement of claims on the Kruger National Par A total of R84 million was awarded to six communities, three from Limpopo, and three from Mpumalang In terms of land area this portion measured 318 000 hectareThe settlement model took into account the significance of the Kruger National Park and assured viable financial compensation as claimants are not able to return to their lan This is in line with equitable redress under government s land restitution programme and marks an important milestone in the country s transformation programmIn further empowering these communities, a 1 per cent community tourism fund has been generating approximately Rmillion per annum for community beneficiatio This has resulted in the building of a number of education facilities including an administration block at Dumisani High School, a computer laboratory at Masiza High School, science laboratories at Tlakulani and Sibusisiswe high schools, a kitchen facility and playground for Grade R learners at Takheleni Primary Schoo In 2016/17 in consultation with the affected communities, the building of four science laboratories in Mbuyane High School; Mahlale Secondary School; Lepato High School and Makuya Secondary School, covering both Limpopo and Mpumalanga provinces have been prioritiseCabinet emphasised the importance of the partnership between multi ethnic communities which contributes to social cohesio South Africa s land restitution model is evolving based on prior experiences and is now underpinned by creating sustainable economic benefit rather than the troubled once-off financial transfers which often left communities no better of Phase 2 of the settlement claim will consist of projects aimed at ensuring the communities continue to benefit in the longer term from business opportunities within the Par The outcomes from the Summit on the Integration of Compensation Systems under the theme

src_text: omago ka Qata Ye nngwe ya dipeelet o t e dikgolo ka Bogarebohlabela ke Sasol, yeo e kgathago tema ye bohlokwa mo tlhabollong ya methopo ya gase ya Qata Dilo t e dingwe t eo go boledi wanego ka t ona di akaret a dikamano t a kgwebo le ekonomi gammogo le khut o ya lefase le dilete le ditaba t a t hirelet
trg_text: Cabinet is encouraged by the launch of the Acid Mine Drainage (AMD) long-term solution at the AMD Central Basin in Germiston which will be two thirds funded by the mining sector and one third by water user This follows the successful completion of the short-term solution under the Inter-Ministerial Committee on AM In 2011 government mandated the Trans-Caledon Tunnel Authority, a State-owned entity under the Department of Water and Sanitation, to provide a short-term solution to the AMD challenge in GautenThe purpose of the long-term solution is to further treat the contaminated water by removing sulphates and creating water for commercial use as either industrial or potable wate.

src_text: Mopresidente Zuma o abile tefo ya naga bjalo ka Karolo ya 1 ya tefo ya dikleimi t a Le oka la Diphoofolo la Kruge Palomoka ya R84 milione e abet we go dit haba t e tshela, t e tharo go t wa Limpopo, le t e tharo go t wa Mpumalanag Go ya ka lefelo la naga karolo ye le lekant we dihektare t e 318 000.Mmotlolo wa tefo o lebelela bohlokwa bja Le oka la Diphoofolo la Kruger gomme o kgonthi a tefo ya t helete ya go kwagala ka ge bakgopedi ba ka se sa kgona go boela nageng ya bon Se se nyalelana le tefo ya go kwagala ka fase ga lenaneo la mmu o la pu et o ya naga gomme le dira se upo se bohlokwa sa mo lenaneong la diphetogo la nagGo t wela pele go matlafat a dit haba t e, 1% ya sekhwama sa set haba sa boeti se dira tekanyet o ya Rmilione ka ngwaga ya kholo ya dit hab Se se dirile gore go agwe dinolofat i t a thuto t e mmalwa go akaret wa ploko ya taolo mo Sekolong se se Phagamego sa Dumisani, laporotori ya dikhomphutha mo Sekolong se se Phagamego sa Masiza, dilaporotori t a saense mo Dikolong t e di Phagamego t a Tlakula le Sibusisiswe, khit i le lebala la barutwana ba Kreiti ya R mo Sekolong sa Praemari sa Takhelen Ka 2016/17 ka poledi ano le dit haba t e di angwago, go aga ga dilaporotori t a saense t e nne mo Sekolong se se Phagamego sa Mbuyane; Sekolong sa Sekontari sa Makuya, go akaret a ka moka diprofense t a Limpopo le Mpumalanga di beilwe pelKabinete e gatelela bohlokwa bja tiri ano gare ga dit haba t a merafent i t eo di kgathago tema mo kopanong ya leag Mmotlolo wa Afrika Borwa wa pu et o ya naga o gola o theilwe godimo ga maitemogelo a pele gomme gonabjale o thekgwa ka go hlola dikholego t a ekonomi ye e swarelelago go feta pheti et o ya mathata ya nako ye tee ya t helete yeo gant i e tlogelago di se gabots Karolo ya 2 ya kleimi ya tefo e tla ba le diprot eke t eo maikemi et o a t ona e lego go kgonthi a gore dit haba di t wela pele go holega mo nakomg ye telele go tloga go dibaka t a kgwebo mo Le okenDipoelo go t wa Samiting ya Kopanyo ya Mekgwa ya Tefo ka fase ga morero
trg_text: Cabinet approved that the Economic Partnership Agreement be submitted to ParliamenThe Agreement will establish a single trade regime between the Southern African Customs Union (SACU) and the E It will also enhance South Africa s preferential access to the European Union market for a range of agricultural products such as sugar, ethanol, wine, fisheries and frui The EPA builds on the Trade and Development Cooperation Agreement (TDCA) that South Africa concluded in 2000 with the EThe Economic Partnership Agreement provides South Africa with additional policy space in several area South Africa also negotiated a bilateral Protocol on Geographical Indicators with the EU, due to growing interest in protecting wine names and specialised agricultural product name As such, 102 wine names will be protected under the Agreement and three agricultural product names namely Rooibos, Honeybush, Karoo LamThe Agreement ensures in line with the National Development Plans objectives that South Africa advances industrialisation and promotes South African exports into the EU marke Most importantly, the EPA promotes the development of regional value chains in Africa thus contributing to regional integratioCabinet approved the publication of the Green Paper on International Migration in the Government Gazette for public commen Cabinet was also briefed on further stakeholder consultations and engagements on the Green Paper for 2016/17.The Green Paper is aligned to the National Development Plan and takes the position that to end poverty and create decent work, migration must be used to break these patterns, by growing our skills and knowledge base and by removing barriers to regional developmen This requires South Africa to invest strategically in the further development of an efficient and secure immigration syste Implementation of International Migration will take us closer to achieving a balance between meeting South Africa s development needs while safeguarding South Africa s integrity and national securitCabinet also approved for the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries to co-host the World Aquaculture Society Conference, together with the Aquaculture Association of Southern Africa, from 26 to 30 June 2017 in South Afric This will be the first time that the World Aquaculture Conference is held in AfricThe aquaculture sector has been prioritised by government to play a pivotal role in food security and economic growth of the countr Aquaculture has been included in the key initiative of Operation Phakisa: Oceans Econom Hosting of this Conference will enable South Africa to fast-track development of and investment in the aquaculture sector through the information and knowledge sharing as well as the networking opportunitieHosting will also create an opportunity for the tourism sector to showcase the country s tourism activities and the local farmers will also showcase their technology innovations at the tradeshow that will cater for more than 100 exhibitors from leading aquaculture nations worldwidAfrican countries will also have an opportunity to participate and showcase their products which will have a positive impact on economic development for the aquaculture sector in the African region and South AfricCabinet was briefed on the refinements made to the Medium Term Strategic Framework (MTSF) Chapter on Outcome 12 and the 2016/17 Programme of Actio This responds to the Cabinet decision to strengthen alignment between the MTSF Chapter on Outcome 12

src_text: yeo e etilwego pele ke Ditona t a Maphelo le Me omo, Aaron Motsoaledi le Mildred Oliphant, gomme ba thekgwa ke Batlat atona ba Methopo ya Diminerale, Maphelo le wa Me omo e amoget wSamiti e nepi a maphelo a me omong le t hirelet o ka pono ya go hlabolla mokgwa wa tefo wo o kopanego wa Afrika Borw Ditona go t wa seleteng sa Dinaga t e di Hlabologago t a Borwa bja Afrika (SADC); Diintasteri t a Meepo t a Afrika Borwa le me omo ye e beakant wego gammogo le mekgatlo ya ba omi ba meepong ba maloba e kgathile tema mo SamitinKa kakanyo ya mokgwa wa tefo wo o kopanego, mmu o o tla kgonthi a gore ba omi le ba omi ba maloba ba meepo le dikholego t a tefo t a me omo ye e lebanego le mebaraka ye e ba fago pabalelo ye e swarelelago le ya malapa a bon Go
trg_text: Mineral Resources were recieveThe summit focused on occupational health and safety with a view to develop an integrated compensation system for South Afric Ministers from the Southern African Development Countries (SADC) region; South African Mining Industry and organised labour as well as the ex-mineworkers associations also participated at the SummiThrough the envisaged integrated compensation system, government will ensure that workers and ex-workers in mines and works receive market related compensation benefits which provides for their sustainable welfare and that of their familie Working together with the workers representatives and mining sector, government aims to implement a monitoring and evaluation system that will provide incentives to companies with good safety and compensation legislation complianc Cabinet welcomed the opening of the country s first Bio-Manufacturing Industry Development Centre (BIDC) in Pretoria by the Department of Science and TechnologThe centre s work is part of the country s Nine Point Plan to unlock the potential of small, medium and micro enterprises (SMMEs).

src_text: oma mmogo le baemedi ba ba omi le makala a meepo, mmu o o ikemi edit e go phethagat a mokgwa wa tekolo le tekanyet o woo o tlo fago tlhohlelet o go dikhamphani t eo di nago le t hirelet o ye botse le go latela molao wa tefKabinete e amoget e pulo ya Senthara ya Tlhabollo ya Intasteri ya T welet o ya Diteng (BIDC) mo Pretoria ka Kgoro ya Saense le Theknolot Mo omo wa senthara ke karolo ya Leano la Dintlha t e Senyane go lokolla bokgoni bja dikgwebopotlana, dikgwebo t a magareng le dikgwebo t e dinnyane (di-SMME).
trg_text: This demonstrates the Rosslyn Plant as being highly competitive within the global BMW production network both in terms of cost of production and qualitIn another investment, the Minister of Trade and Industry launched a R100 million Dursots & All Joy Tomato Processing Plant in Modjadjiskloof near Tzanee The factory currently employs 70 people with a potential increase of 300 by next yea It would also create a further 900 seasonal job The company has also initiated an export structure and plans on exporting 25% of its products to the Middle East, China and the rest of AfricThese investments showcase the steady implementation of the Nine-Point Plan and the Industrial Policy Action Plan (IPAP) that focus on increasing manufacturing-based value addition, employment creation and export-intensity to grow the economy and create job Despite global economic headwinds, the South African economy is poised to forge aheaCabinet reminds all eligible voters to responsibly exercise their democratic right on 3 August 2016.

src_text: E thekga di-SMME t e swaraganego le t welet o ya diteng ka go di kgont ha go hlabolla dibaka t a mmaraka le dilaporotori t a tlhabollKarolo ya pele e tla felelet a ka tlhomo ya me omo ya sa ruri le ya lebakanyana ka khuet o ya ekonomi ye e akanyedit edit wego go R250 milione ka ngwaga mo mengwageng ye mehlano ye e latelag Gonabjale BIDC e thekga dikgwebo t e 19 t eo mo go t ona t e 16 e lego t a bathobaso, go akaret a dikgwebo t eo e lego t a basadi ba bathobaso t e 10.
trg_text: It supports SMMEs involved in bio-manufacturing by enabling them to exploit market opportunitie Companies incubated at the BIDC have access to ready-to-use bio-manufacturing facilities, support in research and development laboratorieThe initial phase will result in the creation of permanent and temporary jobs with the economic impact projected at R250 million per annum in the next five year Currently the BIDC is supporting 19 enterprises of which 16 are owned by black entrepreneurs, including 10 black women-owned enterprise In addition, 55 permanent and 171 temporary jobs have already been created, with 54 interns traine The announcement by the Minister of Energy, Tina Joemat-Pettersson to develop a Gas Policy guides the country towards a sustainable natural gas econom The introduction of gas as an additional source of power in South Africa s energy mix will lessen the dependence of coal and ensure sufficient, diverse and secure energy availability to citizens and the economy, now and into the futur This will also increase the country s trajectory of realising a re-industrialised economy, a higher and inclusive growth path and job creatioIn the interim the Department of Energy is undertaking a gas-to-power programme, which will deliver 3,726MW of electricity and also serve as a catalyst for the development of a local gas industry which will encourage upstream exploration in an investor friendly enabling environmen Employment opportunities associated directly and indirectly with this industry development will amount to 1, 25 million full time equivalent job opportunities over a 25 year perio In the shorter term the gas-to-power programme will contribute to buffer economic output decreases and help prevent job losse The official rollout of the national

trg_text: Cabinet noted the Africa Energy Inward Buying Mission hosted by the Department of Trade and Industry and the South African Electrotechnical Export Counci South African companies with manufacturing and engineering service competencies were exposed to representatives of power utilities from Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, South Sudan and Nigeri This better positioned South African companies to participate in the investment opportunities of the power infrastructure roll-out for Africa estimated at between $20 billion and $42 billion a year over the next 10 year.

trg_text: These include the investment by Toyota for a new Toyota Hilux and Fortuner manufacturing plant in Prospecton, Durban, which was opened by President Jacob Zum This was made possible through the support provided by the Department of Trade and Industry which has attracted investments of over R25 billion in the automotive industry in the past five year This investment will support more than 4 000 jobs with total employment in the plant already exceeding 8 000 jobThis plant is part of Toyota's injection of Rbillion investment into South Africa's manufacturing industry and the country's local vehicle productio Toyota has increased local procurement in its supply chain to support local component suppliers, the company has also focused on recruiting female technicians and providing more opportunities to women in the workforcCabinet also welcomed the BMW announcement on the start of its R6 billion construction of a new, state-of-the-art body sho The expansion will enable BMW to produce and export the next generation of the BMW X3.

trg_text: The former Deputy Chief Justice is a highly regarded jurist and a respected veteran of the country s liberation struggl In his younger years, Moseneke was involved in the liberation struggle as a member of the Pan Africanist Congres He was tried and convicted for his political activities and, at the age of 15, became the youngest prisoner to be incarcerated on Robben Islan He was also part of the technical committee that drafted the interim Constitution in 1993 and was later appointed deputy chairperson of the Independent Electoral Commission ahead of South Africa s first democratic electionCabinet also pays tribute to Supreme Court of Appeal president Judge Lex Mpati who retires from the Bench in May after 27 years of illustrious service to South Afric Judge Mpati personifies the values of rising above self; of modesty, commitment and excellence; and of ethical behaviouCabinet congratulates and extends its best wishes to Justice Baaitse

src_text: tekanyo ya bokgoni bja mohlagase wo o tla fago bareki kgetho ge ba reka didiri w Go tla kgomaret wa leswao mo didiri weng go laet a ka moo di dirago malebana le Maemo a Tiri o ya Enet i ye Nnyan Kabinete e lemogile Africa Energy Inward Buying yeo e bego e swerwe ke Kgoro ya Kgwebo le Intasteri le Khansele ya Ki ontle ya Elektotheknikhale ya Afrika Borw Dikhamphani t a Afrika Borwa t eo di nago le bokgoni bja ditirelo t a t welet o le boent enere di utollet we go baemedi ba Ethiopia, Kenya, Tanzania, Sudan Borwa le Nigeri Dikhgamphani t a Afrika Borwa t e di lego maemong a makaone go t ea karolo mo dibakeng t a peelet o t a go tlholo ya mananeokgoparara a mohlagase ao a akanyedit wego go $20 bilione le $42 bilione ka ngwaga mo mengwageng ye 10 ye e latelag Kabinete e hlohleledit we ke thakgolo ya tharollo ya nako ye telele mo Acid Mine Drainage (AMD) mo AMD Central Basin ka Germiston yeo e tla bago peditharong ye e thekgwago ke karolo ya meepo le teetharong ya ba omi i ba meetsSe se latela go fet a ka katlego ga tharollo ya nako ye kopana ka fase ga Komiti ya Ka gare ya Ditona ka ga AM Ka 2011 mmu o o dumelet e Taolo ya Thanele ya Trans-Caledon, lekala la Mmu o ka fase ga Kgoro ya Meetse le Tlhweki o, go fa tharollo nako ye kopana go tlhohlo ya AMD ka GautenMohola wa tharollo ya nako ye telele ke go
trg_text: This comes as the country gears itself for a transition into the next term of local government ahead of the 2016 municipal electionThe Assembly reflected on the progress made over the last 16 years and during this term of local governmen The role of local government in the delivery of services and the restoration of human dignity was also profile Key challenges were also addressed and a recommitment made to the COGTA Back to Basics programmThis paves the way for the fourth democratic local government term by providing a support programme for municipalities and managing the transition to ensure stability and uninterrupted service provision to the people of South AfricCabinet expressed concern at the disruptions in Parliament, which are increasing in frequency and intensit Parliament is an institution of our hard fought democracy and a public platform which must be respected by alCabinet commends the work of the Inter-Ministerial Committee led by Minister of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs Des van Rooyen and the provincial task team to restore normality to Vuwani, while noting that challenges continue in some partGovernment has worked tirelessly engaging communities in a bid to resolve issues and bring services, including education back into operatio The provision of temporary classrooms has ensured the resumption of academic activitieGovernment again calls on communities and leaders to raise issues through channels and platforms which have been established to enable dialogu This unprecedented action of holding the education of our children hostage is unacceptablCabinet commends all law enforcement agencies for the work done which resulted in the arrest of 34 individuals, who are suspected of participating in the destruction of 28 schools, who in effect shattered the future of those young people who are still utilising these much needed facilitieCabinet commends those communities and civil society organisations who rolled up their sleeves to clean up and raise funds to reopen local school All parents, guardians and community members are requested to assist children to catch up with the scheduled work plan of the Department of Basic Educatio The IMC will continue to engage with stakeholders and communities to ensure that the entire area is calm and returns to normalit Cabinet deliberated on the protests in Hammanskraal and indicated that the Department of Human Settlements is leading an intervention in the area together with the Gauteng Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs and Human Settlements, and the Executive Mayor of Tshwane, Cllr Kgosientso Ramokgop Cabinet regrets the death of two contractors involved in the Hammanskraal removals and expresses its sympathy with the families of the bereave Law enforcement agencies should redouble their efforts to find the killers and bring them to justic Cabinet congratulates the South African Broadcasting Corporation s decision to play 90 per cent local music across all its radio stations so as to promote our home-grown contenThe decision reflects government s broadcasting policy which encourages the safeguarding, enrichment and strengthening of the cultural and social fabric of South Afric This exposure is also motivating to all the upcoming South African talenCabinet encourages all citizens to support our local music industry which will make a significant contribution to the economy and preserve the country s diverse culture Cabinet noted the investigation of nine foreign fishing vessels by Department of Agriculture Forestry and Fisheries and commends the combined operation involving the South African Navy, the Department of Fisheries and the South African Maritime Safety Authority which resulted in four of the vessels being arresteThe capturing of these vessels indicates our seriousness as a country to protect our territorial and exclusive economic zon Our marine resources are a source of food security and play a huge role in realising our goals in Operation Phakisa and must be protecte Cabinet welcomed the release of the report of the ministerial task team appointed by Minister Angie Motshekga to investigate allegations into the selling of posts of educators by members of teachers unions and departmental officials in provincial education department Cabinet congratulated the South African recipients, entrepreneur Luvuyo Rani and The Clothing Bank, who were among the winners of 2016 Social Entrepreneurs awards by the Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship which was presented at the fringes of the World Economic Forum (WEF) Africa, Kigali Rwand Cabinet salutes and extends its good wishes to the former Deputy Chief Justice Dikgang Moseneke who retired from the Bench after joining the Constitutional Court in 2002.

trg_text: Cabinet appeals to all Lesotho nationals who are residing in South Africa illegally to apply for a Lesotho Special Permit at a Visa Facilitation Service Centre before 30 June 2016.

src_text: a fihlelet e malapa a go feta milion Go boa ga papadi ye mo thelebi eneng, go tla hola letseno la Papadi ya Matswele ya Afrika Borwa, e matlafat a papadi ya matswele ya basadi gomme ya thekga bathekgi le boramatswele ba bafsa Diphetho t a Bohlokwa t a Kabinete Kabinete e bodit we ka go phethwa ga ditheri ano ka go fet wa ga ditheri ano le go phumola ga molao ga Tumelelano ya Tiri ano ya Ekonomi gare ga SADC le Dinagakopano t a Yuropa (EU).Kabinete e dumelet e Tumelelano ya Tiri ano ya Ekonomi e i we PalamentenTumelelano e tla thoma mokgwa wa kgwebo e tee gare ga Kopano ya Dit haba t a Borwa bja Afrika (SACU) le E E tla kaonafat a phihlelelo ye e ikgethilego ya Afrika Borwa mo mebarakeng ya EU t a mohlwaela wa dit welet wa t a temo t a go swana le swikiri, ethanol, beine, boreahlapi le dienyw EPA e aga Tumelelanong ya Tiri ano ya Tlhabollo le Kgwebo (TDCA) yeo Afrika Borwa e e dirilego ka 2000 le ETumelelano ya Tiri ano ya Ekonomi e fa Afrika Borwa sekgoba sa pholisi mo mafelong a mmalw Afrika Borwa e reri ane gape ka Ditshepet o t a mohlakanelwa ka ga Maswao a Fase le EU, ka lebaka la kgahlego ye e golago ya go

src_text: irelet eg Phethagat o ya Dikhudugo t a Bodit habat haba e tla re batamet a go fihlelela tekatekano ya gare ga go fihlelela hlabollo ya dinyakwa t a Afrika Borwa mola e boloka tlhompho le t hirelet o ya nagKabinete e dumelet e gape Kgoro ya Temo, Dithokgwa le Boreahlapi go swara mmogo Khonferense ya Set haba ya Lefase la Mokgatlo wa Diphedi t a ka Meetseng wa Borwa bja Afrika, mmogo le Mokgatlo wa Diphedi t a ka Meetseng wa Borwa bja Afrika, go tloga ka la 26 go fihla ka la 30 Phupu 2017 ka Afrika Borw Se e tla ba la mathomo Khonferense ya Diphedi t a ka Meetseng ya Lefase e swarwa ka AfrikLekala la diphedi t a ka meetseng le beilwe pele ke mmu o go raloka karolo ye bohlokwa mo t hirelet ong ya dijo le kgolong ya ekonomi ya nag Diphedi t a ka meetseng di akaredit we mo kgopolong ya motheo ya Operation Phakisa: Ekonomi ya Mawatl Go swarwa ga khonferense ye go tla kgont ha Afrika Borwa go potlaki a hlabollo ya peelet o ka lekaleng la diphedi t a ka meetseng ka go abelana tshedimo o le tsebo gammogo le go dibaka t a go tsebanGo ba mongaeng go tla hlola gape dibaka t a lekala la boeti go bont ha me ongwana ya boeti ya naga le balemi ba gae ba tla bont ha dikaonafat o t a theknolot i mo dipont hong t a kgwebo t e di tla akaret ago babont hi go t wa dinageng t a ketapele mo dipheding t a ka meetseng lefaseng ka mokDinaga t a Afrika di tla ba le sebaka sa go t ea karolo le go bont ha dit welet wa t a bona t eo di tla bago le khuet o ye botse mo hlabollong ya ekonomi mo lekaleng la diphedi t a ka meetseng mo seleteng sa Afrika le Afrika BorwKabinete e bodit we ka dikaonafat o t e di dirilwego mo Tlhako ya Leanophethagat o la Lebaka la Magareng (MTSF) Karolo ya Poelo ya 12 le Lenaneo la Tiri o la 2016/17.
